content.user_title: Slack GIF Creator - Animated GIF Generator
content.value_statement: Create professional animated GIFs optimized for Slack with automatic size optimization, frame validation, and smooth animation effects.
actual_capabilities: Generate animated GIFs from scratch using PIL drawing primitives
Optimize GIFs for Slack's size and dimension requirements (128x128 emoji, 480x480 messages)
Validate GIF files against Slack's constraints
Apply easing functions for smooth animations (bounce, elastic, ease-in/out)
Color quantization and frame deduplication for file size reduction
Draw shapes (circles, stars, polygons), gradients, and text
Support common animation patterns (pulse, shake, bounce, spin, fade, slide, zoom)
limitations: Does not include pre-built graphics or emoji fonts (must draw from scratch or user uploads)
Limited to PIL drawing primitives for graphics creation
No advanced image effects beyond basic PIL filters
Requires manual frame generation for animations

best_practices: Use optimize_for_emoji=True for 128x128 Slack emojis to automatically reduce file size
Keep emoji GIFs under 3 seconds duration for better performance
Use 48-128 colors for optimal file size vs quality balance
Apply easing functions (ease_out, bounce_out) for natural-looking motion
Use thicker lines (width=2+) for better visibility at small sizes
Validate GIFs with validate_gif() before uploading to Slack
Enable remove_duplicates=True to eliminate redundant frames
Use gradient backgrounds and layered shapes for polished appearance
anti_patterns: Don't use emoji fonts (unreliable across platforms)
Avoid width=1 lines (too thin, looks choppy)
Don't create plain shapes without visual depth or detail
Don't exceed 5MB file size (too large for Slack)
Avoid linear motion without easing (looks mechanical)
Don't assume pre-packaged graphics exist in the skill

faq.question: What dimensions should I use for Slack emoji GIFs?
faq.answer: Use 128x128 pixels for emoji GIFs. For message GIFs, use 480x480 pixels. The skill's optimize_for_emoji option automatically handles sizing.

faq.question: How do I reduce the file size of my GIF?
faq.answer: Use fewer frames (lower FPS like 10), reduce num_colors (48 instead of 128), enable optimize_for_emoji=True, and set remove_duplicates=True in the save() method.

faq.question: Can I use uploaded images in my animations?
faq.answer: Yes! Load user-uploaded images with PIL (Image.open()) and incorporate them directly into frames or use as inspiration for colors and style.

faq.question: What easing functions are available?
faq.answer: linear, ease_in, ease_out, ease_in_out, bounce_in, bounce_out, elastic_in, elastic_out, back_in, back_out, and more. See core.easing for full list.

faq.question: How do I validate if my GIF meets Slack requirements?
faq.answer: Use validate_gif('my.gif', is_emoji=True) for detailed validation or is_slack_ready('my.gif') for a quick check.

permissions: File system read/write access for saving GIFs
